par.text: Neptunium is the first of the transuranic elements - synthetic, radioactive elements with an atomic number higher than 92. It is a heavy, silver-coloured metal. Similarly to uranium, it is chemically active: at elevated temperatures it reacts with oxygen to produce neptunium(IV) oxide – Np
; it reacts also with carbon, hydrogen and the halogens. All neptunium isotopes are radioactive. The longest-lived one -
Np - has a half-life of over 2 million years. Neptunium was discovered in 1940 by the American physicists, Edwin M. McMillian and Philip H. Abelson. It was named after the planet Neptune.
